'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2013-09-25 17:28:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

That's exactly what I was thinking"}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-10-27 20:30:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It might be worth making swift.common.direct_client.gen_headers() look something like this:

  def gen_headers(hdrs_in=None, add_ts=False):
      hdrs_out = HeaderKeyDict(hdrs_in) if hdrs_in else HeaderKeyDict()
      if add_ts:
          hdrs_out['X-Timestamp'] = normalize_timestamp(time())
      elif 'X-Timestamp' in hdrs_out:
          hdrs_out['X-Timestamp'] = normalize_timestamp(hdrs_out['X-Timestamp'])
      hdrs_out['User-Agent'] = 'direct-client %s' % os.getpid()
      return hdrs_out

...just as a convenience to callers of direct_put_object() who may have forgotten to normalize a provided 'X-Timestamp' header."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-04 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-04 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-28 17:19:20.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure use of normalized x-timestamp value in APIs

As a follow up to the DELETE timestamp bug (see
https://review.openstack.org/40643 and
https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1196932) the timestamp checks
are not always compared properly, where a given request can provide a
timestamp that, as a float, is newer or older than an already
stored-on-disk timestamp, but lexically "newer" or "older" than that
timestamp.

FIXME: add a unit test for the above

We address this by requiring all X-Timestamp headers to be in
normalize_timestamp() format (11.5), rejecting the request if they are
not, and we change the DatabaseBroker API to also require normalized
timestamps.

FIXME: go back and remove the use of float, normalizing values from
       metadata

FIXME: line wrap test_server.py modules

This change creates the request_timestamp() method in the
request_helpers module to unify the checking and validation of the
X-Timestamp header, returning it as a float. All the references to
X-Timestamp from headers have been modified to use this method.

Additional changes:

  Account Server:

    in DELETE, moved x-timestamp check before mount check so that we
    validate parameters before we touch file systems; this is also the
    case for the POST method

    AccountBroker.delete_db() is now passed a raw float instead of
    whatever is in the request header.

  Container Server:

    All uses of the request header timestamp have been changed to
    float, and the db module interfaces have been updated to accept
    a float handling the normalization there.

  Object Server:

    All uses of the request header timestamp have been changed to get
    their value from the request_timestamp() helper method. All
    x-timestamp attributes in the metadata are normalized to ensure
    their proper use.

  common/constraints.py:

    check_float() was removed, it is no longer used

  common/db.py:

    All DatabaseBroker interfaces used by the account and container
    server code that accept timestamps now ensure they are normalized
    since the servers unmarshall them from the request header as a
    float.

Change-Id: Ifc1d1d3d82730b1581c08aeea6fc7745b3fc3fc9
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-08-28 17:32:25.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure use of normalized x-timestamp value in APIs

Certain REST APIs require the existence of the X-Timestamp
header. Since all of them use the almost identical sequence, we
refactor those blocks of code into one request helper method, removing
the duplication, and enhance that new method to report additional
error conditions (must be a normalized timestamp and must be
non-negative).

This change creates the request_timestamp() method in the
request_helpers module to unify the checking and validation of the
X-Timestamp header, returning it as a float. All the references to
X-Timestamp from headers have been modified to use this method.

Additional changes:

  Account Server:

    In DELETE, moved x-timestamp check before mount check so that we
    validate parameters before we touch file systems; this is
    currently the case for the POST method

  common/constraints.py:

    check_float() was removed, it is no longer used

Change-Id: Ifc1d1d3d82730b1581c08aeea6fc7745b3fc3fc9
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure use of normalized x-timestamp value in APIs

Certain REST APIs require the existence of the X-Timestamp
header. Since all of them use the almost identical sequence, we
refactor those blocks of code into one request helper method, removing
the duplication, and enhance that new method to report additional
error conditions (must be a normalized timestamp and must be
non-negative).

This change creates the request_timestamp() method in the
request_helpers module to unify the checking and validation of the
X-Timestamp header, returning it as a float. All the references to
X-Timestamp from headers have been modified to use this method.

Additional changes:

  Account Server:

    In DELETE, moved x-timestamp check before mount check so that we
    validate parameters before we touch file systems; this is
    currently the case for the POST method

    In PUT, we only verify the timestamp using the new
    request_timestamp method for the external API path, adding an
    explicit parameter check for the other headers for the internal
    "PUT account container" REST API.

  common/constraints.py:

    check_float() was removed, it is no longer used

Change-Id: Ifc1d1d3d82730b1581c08aeea6fc7745b3fc3fc9
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

subject: python3: Various python3 fixes

xmlrpclib doesnt exist in python3 so import xmlrpc.client
if the import fails. Also change instances where iteritems is found.

commit_message:
python3: Various python3 fixes

xmlrpclib doesnt exist in python3 so import xmlrpc.client
if the import fails. Also change instances where iteritems is found.

Change-Id: I1f335bcc8a0d72f44894268d41af8c404291f0c3
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

@Marc: Thank you for your comment.

I read the IRC meeting log[1]. And I think the scenario tests should be smoke. Because the scenario test should cover popular use cases and it's easy to check the integrity of the OpenStack cloud environment.
Do I misunderstand it?

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/qa/2013/qa.2013-10-24-17.00.log.html

And I noticed the *ALL* scenario is wrong but ALL the *non-slow* is right though.

Anyway, I'll write the reason why this change is necessary in the commit message and I'll check the FAILURE of the Jenkins job."}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2013-10-31 11:04:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

so I really want this functional change, however I want to implement it differently. Instead of adding smoke tag to all scenario tests, we should just make the smoke tox target run everything in scenario, so we don't need to tag scenario tests.

I think the neutron fail is a race we've git all morning. The grenade fail is more subtle, and probably just requires a fix in the way grenade sets up tempest.

Good work though, will be very excited to get this in."}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2013-10-31 15:35:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Change all non-slow scenario tests to smoke

Smoke test should be able to check the integrity of the OpenStack cloud
environment easily. And the scenario tests should cover the popular use
cases.
So I think scenario tests should also be executed as smoke tests.
This commit changes all non-slow scenario tests to smoke.

Change-Id: Ia08c7dcec20501a5086e2078439076eeac234cff

commit_message:
add tests for show and update of Flavor Extra Spec API extension

this adds positive and negative  tests for show and update actions
of FlavorExtra Spec API extension.
this checks the extends response attribute that added by all flavor
extension API.
this also move some translation from xml to json into the xml flavor
client, so tests can use xml client and json client in the same way.

Change-Id: I0cf47640a61da8a062ea14b49554911cab8b3be7

This patch adds "ajax-modal" class to LBaaS "Edit" links
to make them open pop-up windows.

Fixes bug 1245811

Change-Id: I78de7ba5c9b87a14e2ef0e5a150c9755d9cbacc1

commit_message:
Fix LBaaS "Edit" forms displaying

This patch adds "ajax-modal" class to LBaaS "Edit" links
to make them open pop-up windows.

Fixes bug 1245811

Change-Id: I78de7ba5c9b87a14e2ef0e5a150c9755d9cbacc1

Do not release FIP on disassociate action

In Instances panel, associate and disassociate
Floating IPs now will be consistent.

Fixes bug #1247245

I think this patch is not a full fix but a partial fix of the bug

When some pool is associated with a VIP, if we select all pools and try to delete them, we got an error "Error: Unable to delete pool. 409-{u'NeutronError': {u'message': u'Pool e4bdbb4a-316b-4cd9-8138-63c94f2d7165 is still in use', u'type': u'PoolInUse', u'detail': u''}}". It is really confusing.

In addition, it is better that a checkbox for pools with VIPs should not be selected or such pool is excluded from the delete pool list.

commit_message:
Remove "Delete Pool" button when a pool is connected to a VIP

Option "Delete Pool" doesn't appear in pool row if there is a
VIP created for this pool.

This patch set partially fixes bug 1234659

Change-Id: I40357dc76943d644de7782275dde3c34fe7faf42

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-03 19:30:40.000000000', 'message': 'scenario cross_tenant_connectivity

This test suite assumes that Nova has been configured to boot VM's with
Neutron-managed networking, and attempts to verify cross tenant connectivity
as follows

ssh:
    in order to overcome "ip namespace", each tenant has an "access point"  VM
    with floating-ip open to incoming ssh connection allowing network commands
    (ping/ssh) to be executed from within the tenant-network-namespace
    Tempest host performs key-based authentication to the ssh server via
    floating IP address

setup:
    for each tenant (demo and alt):
        1. create a network&subnet
        2. create a router (if public router isn't configured)
        3. connect tenant network to public network via router
        4. create an access point:
            a. a security group open to incoming ssh connection
            b. a VM with a floating ip
        5. for demo tenant - create another server to test in-tenant connections

connectivity test is done by pinging destination server via source server ssh
connection.
success - ping returns
failure - ping_timeout reached

tests:
        1. _verify_network_details
        2. _verify_mac_addr: for each access point verify that
        (subnet, fix_ip, mac address) are as defined in the port list
        3. _test_in_tenant_block: test that in-tenant traffic is disabled
        without rules allowing it
        4. _test_in_tenant_allow: test that in-tenant traffic is enabled once an
        appropriate rule has been created
        5. _test_cross_tenant_block: test that cross-tenant traffic is disabled
        without a rule allowing it on destination tenant
        6. _test_cross_tenant_allow:
            * test that cross-tenant traffic is enabled once an appropriate rule
            has been created on destination tenant.
            * test that reverse traffic is still blocked
            * test than revesre traffic is enabled once an appropriate
            * rule has been created on source tenant

assumptions:
        1. alt_tenant/user existed and is different from demo_tenant/user
        2. Public network is defined and reachable from the Tempest host
        3. Public router can either be:
            * defined, in which case all tenants networks can connect directly
            to it, and cross tenant check will be done on the private IP of the
            destination tenant
            or
            * not defined (empty string), in which case each tanant will have
            its own router connected to the public network

helper changes:

manager:
    1. move network and router creation to mananger
    (from scenario/test_network_basic_ops)
    2. add set_resource=True to _create_secgroup_rule() so you can create a rule
    not deleted by tearDown this is workaround for bug 1247568 in
    python-neutronclient (preventing tearDownClass from ignoring deleted neutron
    resources

Change-Id: I9c5d8795c2cc08e9ebd836c58919c811aa3abe80
'}]
commit_message:
scenario cross_tenant_connectivity

This test suite assumes that Nova has been configured to boot VM's with
Neutron-managed networking, and attempts to verify cross tenant connectivity
as follows

ssh:
    in order to overcome "ip namespace", each tenant has an "access point"  VM
    with floating-ip open to incoming ssh connection allowing network commands
    (ping/ssh) to be executed from within the tenant-network-namespace
    Tempest host performs key-based authentication to the ssh server via
    floating IP address

setup:
    for each tenant (demo and alt):
        1. create a network&subnet
        2. create a router (if public router isn't configured)
        3. connect tenant network to public network via router
        4. create an access point:
            a. a security group open to incoming ssh connection
            b. a VM with a floating ip
        5. for demo tenant - create another server to test in-tenant connections

connectivity test is done by pinging destination server via source server ssh
connection.
success - ping returns
failure - ping_timeout reached

tests:
        1. _verify_network_details
        2. _verify_mac_addr: for each access point verify that
        (subnet, fix_ip, mac address) are as defined in the port list
        3. _test_in_tenant_block: test that in-tenant traffic is disabled
        without rules allowing it
        4. _test_in_tenant_allow: test that in-tenant traffic is enabled once an
        appropriate rule has been created
        5. _test_cross_tenant_block: test that cross-tenant traffic is disabled
        without a rule allowing it on destination tenant
        6. _test_cross_tenant_allow:
            * test that cross-tenant traffic is enabled once an appropriate rule
            has been created on destination tenant.
            * test that reverse traffic is still blocked
            * test than revesre traffic is enabled once an appropriate
            * rule has been created on source tenant

assumptions:
        1. alt_tenant/user existed and is different from demo_tenant/user
        2. Public network is defined and reachable from the Tempest host
        3. Public router can either be:
            * defined, in which case all tenants networks can connect directly
            to it, and cross tenant check will be done on the private IP of the
            destination tenant
            or
            * not defined (empty string), in which case each tanant will have
            its own router connected to the public network

helper changes:

manager:
    1. move network and router creation to mananger
    (from scenario/test_network_basic_ops)
    2. add set_resource=True to _create_secgroup_rule() so you can create a rule
    not deleted by tearDown this is workaround for bug 1247568 in
    python-neutronclient (preventing tearDownClass from ignoring deleted neutron
    resources

Change-Id: I9c5d8795c2cc08e9ebd836c58919c811aa3abe80

/sbin/parted is throwing an 'invalid option' error when setting the
partition endpoint to -0 (which tells parted to extend the partition
to the end of the disk). This change surrounds the parted argument
with quotes to ensure it is parsed properly.

Fixes bug 1247307

Change-Id: I3bd2e25404d002329aa0ea53e9b60b69c90c0adb
"}, {'created': '2013-11-02 00:42:50.000000000', 'message': "Parted 'invalid option' in XenAPI driver

"}, {'created': '2013-11-02 02:30:51.000000000', 'message': "Parted 'invalid option' in XenAPI driver

/sbin/parted is throwing an 'invalid option' error when setting the
partition endpoint to -0 (which tells parted to extend the partition
to the end of the disk). This change adds '--' to indicate the
remaining args are not options.

Fixes bug 1247307

commit_message:
Parted 'invalid option' in XenAPI driver

/sbin/parted is throwing an 'invalid option' error when setting the
partition endpoint to -0 (which tells parted to extend the partition
to the end of the disk). This change adds '--' to indicate the
remaining args are not options.

Fixes bug 1247307

Change-Id: I3bd2e25404d002329aa0ea53e9b60b69c90c0adb

commit_message:
Fix setting backdoor port in service start

Previously if self.manager wasn't defined for a Service object but a
backdoor_port was specified then that particular service would not
start because it would try to set the backdoor port in an object that
didn't exist. This commit fixes setting the backdoor port only if
manager is defined when calling start().

Closes-Bug: #1243260

Change-Id: Ib0e709cfd0e299a3e010450b7eba6e92bc108e4e
(cherry picked from commit e5c96505c0b4eac51c0925dcb691f0a1699216ce)

commit_message:
Avoid suppressing underlying error when deploy.loadapp fails

Raise log level at the first load attempt. If there is a
fundamental problem with the environment, a Lookup error
is not helpful in troubleshooting the problem further.

Fix bug 1210236

(cherry picked from commit: 696e9f3fc8ef7e8bd2a8f21071f3ef91fac14ad5)

Change-Id: I55aa11a0e5a37dbef3f0c1b55aa4c9c11bbf55d9

[{'created': '2013-11-03 13:39:47.000000000', 'message': 'Enable create volume on force hosts

Cinder scheduler will help select host for create request based on
scheduler filters, but end user cannot create volume directly on a
force host.

This patch enhanced the option of "--availability-zone" for "cinder
create" to provide force hosts option. If end user specify
"--availability-zone zone1:host1", this means that customer want to
create the volume on force host host1.

Implements bp cinder-force-host

Change-Id: I76311d7f99e1bcd3515a78b37cae1c0bfc2fb972
'}]
commit_message:
Enable create volume on force hosts

Cinder scheduler will help select host for create request based on
scheduler filters, but end user cannot create volume directly on a
force host.

This patch enhanced the option of "--availability-zone" for "cinder
create" to provide force hosts option. If end user specify
"--availability-zone zone1:host1", this means that customer want to
create the volume on force host host1.

Implements bp cinder-force-host

Change-Id: I76311d7f99e1bcd3515a78b37cae1c0bfc2fb972

[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-10-25 23:36:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

To answer the question from the bug, the reason this wasn't caught is because there is no CI support for the docker driver. I'd *really* like to see that change soon :)

The patch that added this argument to the destroy method incorrectly missed adding this to the base driver definition in nova/virt/driver.py.

I'd appreciate it if you would patch that and add a case to test_virt_drivers (which your tests make use of) which would have caught this even without integration testing.

Just making your driver as broken as the others to avoid the crash is not a very good solution, IMHO :)

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 7838, 'date': '2013-10-25 23:38:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree with you but do you think it's a better solution to keep this broken for now?"}, {'account_id': 7838, 'date': '2013-10-25 23:49:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fixes the destroy() method for the Docker virt driver

* Added the missing "context" argument in nova/virt/driver.py
* Added the missing argument in the test_virt_drivers.destroy() as well so it
will make sure none of the other drivers will miss it.

Change-Id: I083b935da95c28ad4f9879036ef2bf7c1fbbb58e
Closes-Bug: #1244829

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-31 10:39:14.000000000', 'message': "VMware: fix bug for reporting instance UUID's

Ensure that the correct UUID's are reported to the compute
manager. The fix will return only valid UUID's and not all
of the names of the instances running.

Closes-Bug: #1237795

Change-Id: I32bb6f4783dcc80697abebd5a7f45ef9950a0896
(cherry picked from commit 74289aacb5363bd72b449580325a651117e5342d)
"}]
commit_message:
VMware: fix bug for reporting instance UUID's

Ensure that the correct UUID's are reported to the compute
manager. The fix will return only valid UUID's and not all
of the names of the instances running.

Closes-Bug: #1237795

Change-Id: I32bb6f4783dcc80697abebd5a7f45ef9950a0896
(cherry picked from commit 74289aacb5363bd72b449580325a651117e5342d)

commit_message:
Corrections for Ceilometer setup on Compute node

- Correct package and service names for RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.
- Use <systemitem class="service"> instead of <literal> for service names.
- Removed redundant os profiling condition (os was set on both step and
  the screen element within the step).

backport: havana
Change-Id: Ibb75b26c7b943db616c0a0d759e9f9826f5bb2f9
(cherry picked from commit 6f0db799f9f9853a4485736356288bb4760165a2)

commit_message:
Adds a link to the Debian wiki

This patch adds a link to http://wiki.debian.org/OpenStack,
so that users know how to report bugs to the Debian BTS.
It also adds (Wheezy) to the Debian 7.0 titles.

Change-Id: I258f562314be49668f9fb921296c415be644e32b
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit 3ba2cc2e8bce995e3c0d49b76095fa84ab53440d)

Regarding Avishay's comment, GPFSDriver base class does not inherit from NfsDriver.  It's a good idea to wrap the new lines in a gpfs function though, with a name like "_verify_gpfs_path_state" that can be easily added whereever it's needed.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2013-10-30 23:00:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Think moving this into a separate function is a good idea and agree with Bill's comments."}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-10-31 07:43:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Bill, I didn't mean to imply that the GPFS driver inherits from NFS driver, but rather to use a similar technique (separate function that is called from many operations - need to carefully consider which)."}, {'account_id': 8574, 'date': '2013-10-31 08:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Beside the commit message nit, there is a question about which operations this should be verified for.  For example, why not delete_volume, or copy_volume_to_image, or snapshot operations?  On the one hand you want to check to make sure the operation will succeed and print a clear error message if it won't, on the other hand you don't want to fail operations unnecessarily. Qin, I think you missed my comment in the previous patch set:

Beside the commit message nit, there is a question about which operations this should be verified for. For example, why not delete_volume, or copy_volume_to_image, or snapshot operations? On the one hand you want to check to make sure the operation will succeed and print a clear error message if it won't, on the other hand you don't want to fail operations unnecessarily. Please go over all operations and choose where to verify that GPFS is mounted."}, {'account_id': 8574, 'date': '2013-10-31 16:26:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Avishay,
This code change is not going to make every operation succeed. If the operation fail with error, and another cinder operation can recover the problem, I think that is acceptable. For example, I add this checking to create_volume(), because if we do not check it, the file on local disk and the volume record in DB can not be removed by cinder delete.
At this point, I feel create_volume(), _clone_image(), copy_image_to_volume() must have this checking. In all other cases, there will be an error, but I think that is correct behavior and acceptable. Do you agree?'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-11-01 08:22:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

OK, I'm convinced.  I was thinking that if delete_volume was implemented with 'rm -f' that wouldn't be caught either, or other such operations.  If you've gone through them all and all will now fail if GPFS is not mounted, I'm OK with it.  Adding this to all operations would provide clearer error messages, but will add overhead - you can decide in the future if it's necessary."}, {'account_id': 8574, 'date': '2013-11-01 13:30:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Avishay,
Thank you very much! I am still verifying those volume/snapshot operation. I will post new patch, once new problem is found. Currently, I feel those codes were not fully validated under negative scenario. I will consider to add some new test cases.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-11-01 18:29:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

commit_message:
Examine if GPFS is mounted before writing data.

If GPFS is not mounted, throw an exception and log the error message. That will
prevent create_volume(), copy_image_to_volume() or _clone_image() to create
file on local disk, which can not be removed by the driver code itself.

Change-Id: If5d4c7a88e82362d2a87068202926b1ca82d9dff
Closes-Bug: #1242511

commit_message:
Add notification on deleting instance without host

If an instance which does not have a host associated is deleted, the
corresponding notifications were not being sent. Fixed the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1211742

Change-Id: I56482ab38725e6f1ddfb14350637d329f35095b3
(cherry picked from commit bbab55c4da531e4695a6e3e577aaa4975f0fce79)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-01 17:04:07.000000000', 'message': 'Sanitize passwords when logging payload in wsgi

adminPass (or admin_pass) can be either part of a json object or
an xml element or xml attribute. The patch includes
regexps to support all these cases and adds tests
as well

Change-Id: Ic119f986a03863c1d13b566b4c005f3bc77d83d0
Closes-Bug: 1231263
(cherry picked from commit c6d82083295e9b1b42f22d3a2d25a1ab7d341a13)

commit_message:
Sanitize passwords when logging payload in wsgi

adminPass (or admin_pass) can be either part of a json object or
an xml element or xml attribute. The patch includes
regexps to support all these cases and adds tests
as well

Change-Id: Ic119f986a03863c1d13b566b4c005f3bc77d83d0
Closes-Bug: 1231263
(cherry picked from commit c6d82083295e9b1b42f22d3a2d25a1ab7d341a13)

[{'created': '2013-10-30 18:27:02.000000000', 'message': "Make unshelve use new style BDM

Unshelving an instance requires recreating it, and since change
I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea, it is necessary to call
compute manager's _prep_block_device with new style BDMs.

This patch makes the conductor return new-style BDMs when unshelving the
instance.

Closes-bug: 1246412
blueprint: clean-up-legacy-block-device-mapping

Change-Id: I0ba9f53c31c4d5238319cfd09600ad64f298629e
(cherry picked from commit 7fb9fcc970324236267d893185b421e26b1cb1d9)
"}]
commit_message:
Make unshelve use new style BDM

Unshelving an instance requires recreating it, and since change
I5b9c3e2d959c602fa22f49db681da918ae0adcea, it is necessary to call
compute manager's _prep_block_device with new style BDMs.

This patch makes the conductor return new-style BDMs when unshelving the
instance.

Closes-bug: 1246412
blueprint: clean-up-legacy-block-device-mapping

Change-Id: I0ba9f53c31c4d5238319cfd09600ad64f298629e
(cherry picked from commit 7fb9fcc970324236267d893185b421e26b1cb1d9)

commit_message:
Fixes for LBaas documentation

   * Removed status from Health monitor
   * Added expect_codes, url_path, and http_method to response for Update and Create Monitor
   * Added status_description field to Pool, VIP, and Member tables

Also added another example to Update and create monitor and added status_description to samples for VIP, Pool, and Member.

Closes-Bug: #1213932

Change-Id: I07b1d3c2d0ff0decd11f999169462196be0d82df

(2 inline comments)

I think the critical bit you're missing from this patch is an entry in setup.cfg. In the section

nova.api.v3.extensions.server.update = 
    user_data = nova.api.openstack.compute.plugins.v3.user_data:UserData

and I think things will start working for you. If you run it in devstack you should be able to see in the nova-api logs that update function is extended.

Hope this helps, if you run into any other issues, please feel free to ping me on irc and I can give you a hand.

Something like: "Running _update_extension_point for os-user-data" I think.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-03 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This change allows user_data to be an attribute that can be updated
via the nova API server update call by adding update support to the
existing v3 os-user-data extension.

This will be used by Heat to deliver changed user data to servers

commit_message:
Implement a v3 API extension to update user_data

This change allows user_data to be an attribute that can be updated
via the nova API server update call by adding update support to the
existing v3 os-user-data extension.

This will be used by Heat to deliver changed user data to servers
via the nova metadata API.

Partially implements blueprint update-userdata

Change-Id: Ic2fedc9b5c7d63cb19e72abd986ef6bd421de4aa

commit_message:
Implement a v2 API extension to update user_data

This change allows user_data to be an attribute that can be updated
via the nova API server update call via the os-user-data-update
extension.

This will be used by Heat to deliver changed user data to servers
via the nova metadata API.

Partially implements blueprint update-userdata

Change-Id: Icd67c68b8d37831f57b2577d76e44ac2b793364e

commit_message:
Send delete.end with latest instance state

Delete.end notifications were getting sent with a blank deleted_at
field. This meant that services listening to notifications for
instance state changes could potentially never get the instances
deleted_at value. The instance usage audit notification would be
the only source for that value.

This change returns the destroyed instance from the conductor API
and sends the delete.end notification with that state, containing
the deleted_at value which was just set.

UpgradeImpact
Closes-Bug: #1241681
Change-Id: I3481e0bada1711c3bff50f249f6a2b40a4ea6855

Doug Hellmann,

Thanks for pointing out this . Can you suggest which library I'd better choose, not just byte unit constants, maybe some durations like hour ,day .(I'm not familar with PyPI ,actually  I have been reading your book about python libray :P)"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-10-12 13:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I am not personally familiar with any, but it looks like there are a few options to evaluate:

https://pypi.python.org/pypi?%3Aaction=search&term=Units&submit=search

There is a similar discussion on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44652/ so maybe we can pick one library that meets both requirements?

And I hope you find the book helpful! :)'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-10-14 02:05:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Take a look at the docstring of this module

Maybe this fits both of our needs?

https://code.google.com/p/byteformat/source/browse/src/byteformat.py'}, {'account_id': 6722, 'date': '2013-10-15 04:52:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Doug Hellmann && ZhongYue,

I think my patch focuses different point with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44652/. This patch focuss on providing  byte unit constants to avoid using hardcode numeric expression everywhere, such as "size = ephemeral_gb * 1024 * 1024 * 1024".
We can replace that with "size = ephemeral_gb * byte.Gi"

*not* human readable unit conversion

Thank you all the same . You help me do more investigation about byte standard. :)'}, {'account_id': 6722, 'date': '2013-10-15 05:14:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6722, 'date': '2013-10-15 05:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-15 05:21:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

There are several on PyPI, and if we can find one that includes the ability to parse unit expressions, too, then that would solve the other changeset at the same time.'}, {'account_id': 6722, 'date': '2013-10-15 11:22:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add unit constants

There are lots of numeric expressions across some projects, such as
1024*1024 , 1024**3, 1000, 1000000 etc. This patch adds binary and
decimal unit constants and will sync into other projects. Replacing
nummeric experssions with these constants makes code more readable.

blueprint byte-unit-clean

Change-Id: I5093244f607d8c3a61a5f6b7ecbe657e5574b793

commit_message:
Corrections for Ceilometer setup on Compute node

- Correct package and service names for RHEL/CentOS/Fedora.
- Use <systemitem class="service"> instead of <literal> for service names.
- Removed redundant os profiling condition (os was set on both step and
  the screen element within the step).

backport: havana
Change-Id: Ibb75b26c7b943db616c0a0d759e9f9826f5bb2f9

commit_message:
Adds a link to the Debian wiki

This patch adds a link to http://wiki.debian.org/OpenStack,
so that users know how to report bugs to the Debian BTS.
It also adds (Wheezy) to the Debian 7.0 titles.

Change-Id: I258f562314be49668f9fb921296c415be644e32b
backport: havana

commit_message:
Debian specifics for Glance

This patch adds Debian specifics for Glance, and removes
the parts which aren't needed for Debian (since the
configuration is automated in Debian).

Note that this is a break-down of:
https://review.openstack.org/54394/

into smaller patches.

backport: havana

Change-Id: I72c6f1958c292d86cd328a186d717d7022be59a2
(cherry picked from commit c7b575c08aabf4e15e5c6be18c87ff728edb1e4f)

and removes the unwanted parts of the manual that are
automatically configured in the Debian package.

(cherry picked from commit df37e69d774b458dae431b92ded13b45e703267b)

commit_message:
Fix all scripts to honor the enabled_ssl_apis flag

Add logic to allow configuration of SSL for all the cmd scripts
that start a WSGIService

Change-Id: I921013d113081a91a3fe9bb574bae5cd7bb06bcc
Closes-Bug: 1237126
(cherry picked from commit 08c6664d8f36ef48f28bed9afbd4aae21f6eb2d5)

commit_message:
Pull system_metadata for notifications on instance.save()

When saving changes on an instance object a notification is sent out.
An attempt is made to pull flavor information from the instance but if
system_metadata is not joined then an exception is raised and the
notification fails.  This ensures that system_metadata is available for
those notifications.

Conflicts:

	nova/objects/base.py

The conflict is from change Icd2944f17b6100d51007dbc48da90e4e992bbd48

Change-Id: Ifd317f847c3839cd6019038bb3dc856b9f107000
Closes-bug: 1244311
(cherry picked from commit e03963b1e42ca2900b108201e77edf2386c5c46a)

commit_message:
NetApp fix ssc volume filtering inconsistency

This fixes the situation when the actual netapp
volume data structure becomes inconsistent
because of operating on the actual object
than the copy of it. It also introduces some checks
before calculating volume stats.

Change-Id: I626f9ca9aa8c7cc41ba4aa6058f14cc040f7301f
Closes-Bug:#1243081
(cherry picked from commit 1d503937e841da27f5e3441775b2d208e44f5e75)

NetApp fix for 7mode iscsi volume stats

This fixes the bug for reporting correct
capacity information in case of 7mode
iscsi drivers.

Change-Id: Ie41009eca866830173809211d58470025be847e3
Closes-Bug: #1238967
(cherry picked from commit e4bde7adda4e885fe847e0bacc4d3fc84547e723)

commit_message:
add dbus_service name for different platforms

on redhat6.4/centos, the dbus_service name is
messagebus, and on other platforms, it's dbus.
So I enhanced it, and updated the CHANGELOG.md
and metadata.rb .

Change-Id: I5548acc38b5e2cbf5e1d5d482cadbd876392daa4
Closes-Bug: #1244574

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-01 21:20:01.000000000', 'message': 'Adds basic plumbing for RESTful API service

This patch adds some basic plumbing for a Solum RESTful
API service. It uses the excellent and simple Falcon library
as its WSGI pipeline processing and route handling. Included
is a simple VersionsResource and a few serialization helpers
along with tests that cover all of the added code. Hoping that
this patch will spark some discussions around how to approach
building the API service.

Change-Id: Ide13035bd91c5a4f326ea980020e3b1aedecc92a
'}]
commit_message:
Adds basic plumbing for RESTful API service

This patch adds some basic plumbing for a Solum RESTful
API service. It uses the excellent and simple Falcon library
as its WSGI pipeline processing and route handling. Included
is a simple VersionsResource and a few serialization helpers
along with tests that cover all of the added code. Hoping that
this patch will spark some discussions around how to approach
building the API service.

Change-Id: Ide13035bd91c5a4f326ea980020e3b1aedecc92a

It describe generalities about the Debconf OpenStack. It
explains how the following is handled:
- Database config (using dbconfig-common)
- RabbitMQ config
- API endpoint registrations
- keystone_authtoken config
- preseeding

Also, a number of screenshots are added.

Note that this is a break-down of:
https://review.openstack.org/54394/

into smaller patches.

backport: havana
Change-Id: Ia5d8e5fc3d397f9441ecb50ef4a3458672307bdc
(cherry picked from commit c9728d9539752e828f88f4bec428e84346d28f47)

commit_message:
Adds a new debconf chapter

This patch adds a new debconf chapter in the Debian docs.
It describe generalities about the Debconf OpenStack. It
explains how the following is handled:
- Database config (using dbconfig-common)
- RabbitMQ config
- API endpoint registrations
- keystone_authtoken config
- preseeding

Also, a number of screenshots are added.

Note that this is a break-down of:
https://review.openstack.org/54394/

into smaller patches.

backport: havana
Change-Id: Ia5d8e5fc3d397f9441ecb50ef4a3458672307bdc
(cherry picked from commit c9728d9539752e828f88f4bec428e84346d28f47)

commit_message:
added new exception cinderclient.ConnectionError

Introduced new exception cinderclient.ConnectionError
with the change  I37da522e812286e72706409b8a6d4652515f720f.

Adding the exception cinderclient.ConnectionError to the
RECOVERABLE list solves the issues described in the
bug ##1207635.

fixes bug #1207635

Change-Id: I6b90343e79433fe554d84df1db65e096c8ed4423

[{'created': '2013-10-28 23:44:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix status_code not passed in code

The python-neutronclient was refactored to raise NeutronClientException
and when that occured the status_code field was dropped. This causes errors
on the nova-side to occur as nova checks the status_code to do error handling.

Fixes bug: 1245700

Change-Id: Ie1fcf3fef0e20c33ce18549bca6a2413a9f98e9f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix status_code not passed in code

The python-neutronclient was refactored to raise NeutronClientException
and when that occured the status_code field was dropped. This causes errors
on the nova-side to occur as nova checks the status_code to do error handling.

Fixes bug: 1245700

Change-Id: Ie1fcf3fef0e20c33ce18549bca6a2413a9f98e9f

subject: Fixes neutron setup for Debian

commit_message:
Fixes neutron setup for Debian

This patch completely removes the section_neutron-install.xml
section from the Debian install-guide, since that part is
completely automated in Debian, and describes how the plugin
system works in Debian. It then customize the other sections
to fit the Debian installation procedure.

Change-Id: Ib1fabd7f64d513132484b98541cef2e4276ccfe8
backport: havana
(cherry picked from commit ac32f3ac9482eeeb3263bee51c097cb040eda0b5)

Sync latest code from oslo

Sync latest code from oslo , using command 'cd oslo-incubator &&
./update.sh ../heat'

subject: Protocol Discovery Extension for (Federated) Authentication
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 5956, 'name': 'Kristy Siu', 'email': 'kwss@kent.ac.uk', 'username': 'kwss'}, {'_account_id': 6534, 'name': 'David Chadwick', 'email': 'd.w.chadwick@truetrust.co.uk', 'username': 'd-w-chadwick'}, {'_account_id': 6723, 'name': 'Vincent Giersch', 'email': 'vincent@giersch.fr', 'username': 'vincent-giersch'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 5956, 'date': '2013-08-14 12:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6534, 'date': '2013-08-14 13:12:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think the extension name OS-PROTOCOLS is too generic, since Keystone may support other protocols besides authn ones. I would therefore prefer that the extension be named OS-AUTHN-PROTOCOLS. Otherwise OK"}, {'account_id': 5956, 'date': '2013-08-14 13:59:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-14 14:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/07/41907/3/check/gate-noop/e3753d8 : SUCCESS in 0s
'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-08-14 15:48:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Protocol-providers relationship looks very similar to service-endpoints relationship.

Is this extension even necessary? Can't we just use services and endpoints to convey protocols and providers?"}, {'account_id': 6534, 'date': '2013-08-14 15:55:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Guang. In fact this is how we have implemented it, by using the existing service catalog. But earlier discussions on the federated authn API extension, suggested you all wanted a separate extension for protocol discovery that was not tied to the existing service catalog, and therefore a separate API was needed. Implementation wise it can then either use the service catalog (as we have done) or use a completely separate mechanism.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-08-14 16:59:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

David, sorry I didn't realize the extend of protocol-provider relationship till I saw the details in this review. I think using the existing catalog make sense."}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-08-16 07:10:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I would think the problem with using the service catalog would be (to my understanding) you shouldn't be getting a service catalog until you have received a scoped token. This information would need to be retrieved unauthenticated. 

Assuming we still need the extension i would still mount the whole thing at /OS-FEDERATED/protocols as suggested and i think all your 'self' links are wrong as they would point to url/OS-FEDERATED/protocols/<id>"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-24 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-24 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 5956, 'date': '2013-10-24 10:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored

Restoring now I have returned to work'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-10-24 16:59:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I think that we need to make this a read only API and merge it in with the IdP extension.  To support a protocol is going to require Python code changes, and you will not be able to just add a protocol on the fly, will you?"}, {'account_id': 6534, 'date': '2013-10-25 08:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Adam, I think this API is not adding new protocols, but only adding new IDPs who support a particular protocol. So I dont think any changes are needed to its scope'}, {'account_id': 5956, 'date': '2013-10-25 09:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

There seems to be some confusion. The aim of this API is not to enable adding new protocols, only to manage IdPs of already supported types and to query what types are supported.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-02 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-10-25 07:10:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm thinking this should probably be handled at the novaclient level, not at the nova API level."}, {'account_id': 7040, 'date': '2013-10-25 08:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Chris, if we handle it in client, then how about those rest call directly to server?'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-10-25 12:15:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

A client which uses the REST client directly can list the flavors first and lookup the id to pass to delete. Adding this functionality means the request to delete is ambiguous in that it may delete a flavor by either id or name and the client doesn't really know ahead of time which (there could be a race where someone adds a flavor with an id that is the same as a name at the same time someone attempts to delete a flavor with that name) - and I think that's bad.

Given that the id for a flavor is not a uuid either (nor really unique!) I think its not great the nova client also accepts either id or name - I think it should probably require the user to specify if they are deleting by name or id so there is no ambiguity."}, {'account_id': 4601, 'date': '2013-10-25 13:12:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Well... the API documentation really says the api accepts only flavor_id. Maybe it's better to change the client instead."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-02 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-02 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Fixes the API FlavorManageController delete method

nova flavor-delete accepts both 'id' and 'name' for deleting
a flavor. However, the existent implementation of the API
FlavorManager only looks for the flavor by id.

This patch adds a lookup also by name for the flavor that is being
deleted.

Change-Id: I4ed64647c2a45ed8ec19d17ac3a6e2545c908fc9
Closes-Bug: #1244043

[{'created': '2013-10-25 06:32:42.000000000', 'message': 'Brick connector fix for NFS drivers

This change fixes the error that comes
while getting brick connector and attaching volumes
in case of NFS drivers in cinder. The attribute for
mount point base was not passed to attach_volume method
as the connector initialization logic is common for all
types of protocols. It is fixed by populating
the required parameter in the RemoteFsConnector
for NFS drivers.

Change-Id: I8601326b318f6f8c53a03610f1b4f2bfd14070ff
Closes-Bug: #1238085
(cherry picked from commit b6b9df2940ac07f715f759f4c315b2cf088c2320)
'}]
commit_message:
Brick connector fix for NFS drivers

This change fixes the error that comes
while getting brick connector and attaching volumes
in case of NFS drivers in cinder. The attribute for
mount point base was not passed to attach_volume method
as the connector initialization logic is common for all
types of protocols. It is fixed by populating
the required parameter in the RemoteFsConnector
for NFS drivers.

Change-Id: I8601326b318f6f8c53a03610f1b4f2bfd14070ff
Closes-Bug: #1238085
(cherry picked from commit b6b9df2940ac07f715f759f4c315b2cf088c2320)

commit_message:
Introducing bower
 added bower.json - config file, add customized or not bowerized plugins to bower simple files
 Changed main.js to fit new bower libs tree

as proposed in nova https://review.openstack.org/49971

Implements blueprint update-userdata

replace assertLessEqual - is not in py26 testtools

Replaced with the testtools matcher and assertThat.

Fixes LP Bug #1233513

commit_message:
Add quota table in Cisco N1kv plugin

Add quota table in the Cisco n1kv plugin since quota DB driver
in Neutron is enabled by default.

Change-Id: I4b715c22449aed0a53ea4ddf74a5d65907010a48
Closes-Bug: 1239974

commit_message:
Fixes encoding issues for nova api req body.

* Ensure utf-8 encoding for POST/PUT body for api requests
* As per https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Encoding.

Fixes bug #1180344

Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py

Change-Id: Iea0f16b0c024795fb3aee1cd38bb54ee9da6d90d
(cherry picked from commit 781815b3b27cc3fcbf153db57deb9bd82ae1d8d3)

subject: Include instance sub-object updated dates when returning instance info
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7179, 'name': 'Brad Pokorny', 'email': 'brad_pokorny@symantec.com', 'username': 'bpokorny'}]

- check-grenade-devstack-vm http://logs.openstack.org/80/53680/1/check/check-grenade-devstack-vm/69c5cfb : SUCCESS in 54m 02s
- gate-devstack-vm-cells http://logs.openstack.org/80/53680/1/check/gate-devstack-vm-cells/3c2fdda : FAILURE in 14m 20s (non-voting)
- gate-nova-pylint http://logs.openstack.org/80/53680/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/f130656 : SUCCESS in 13m 24s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-10-24 18:48:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

So an instance appears modified if one of its security groups or pci_devices is modified? What about instance_info_cache, which the user has no visibility to?

AFAIK, an instance should only get a new updated_at date if the user takes some action on it, which means that needs to be done (and is, AFAIK) in compute_api as a result of something happening.

Further, your change here makes the Instance object look artificially different than what is in the database, which is not what we should be shooting for, IMHO.

I'm not sure metadata changes should make it appear updated either, but if they should, it should be handled differently than this."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-10-24 18:58:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(12 inline comments)

Dan hit this before I could, but I'll leave my -1 with comments anyway."}, {'account_id': 7179, 'date': '2013-10-24 19:47:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for your comments, Dan and Matt.

Dan, I had some of the same concerns with this approach as you that I wrote up in the bug.  This approach is similar to the second option I put in the bug, although the change isn't in python-novaclient.

I think your suggestion to make the change in compute_api is similar to the first option I put in the bug.  For example, when a user updates metadata via the API, update the date for the instance at the same time.  I didn't see a way to have the database layer update the date in the instances table without updating another value for the instance, but that could be added to the DB layer as a separate commit to support this.

Would that be a more reasonable way to go about this?

The current behavior is simply tied to the database model, which has been fine for most cases.  In this case, users of the API are surprised to see changing metadata isn't reflected in the updated date when doing a Get on the instance.  So I think the question of whether metadata changes should make the instance appear updated warrants some discussion."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-10-24 19:55:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's not tied to the DB model right now, is it? I think it's updated in compute_api.

If we decide that metadata updates should update the timestamp, then yes, I think it should be done in the metadata manipulation methods of compute_api.

I do think it's worth discussing whether it should or not, though, since that would be a change in behavior visible externally. I.e. some user is coding against some provider running new code, sees that metadata updates change that stamp, and makes their code wait for that to be updated before continuing. They move to some other provider using an older version and their code is broken."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-10-24 20:05:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

From a user's perspective, I think I *would* expect the updated time to change when metadata gets updated.  It seems like a bug that it isn't.

As for changing behavior, in the scenario you gave, it kind of just seems like they switched to a provider that doesn't have the bug fixed yet."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-10-24 20:06:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

updated_at is not meant to reflect the last time metadata, etc was updated for the instance.  It only represents in the DB the last time the row was modified.  That's why it exists on every single model.

If you want a column to reflect last time anything was modified for an instance (including metadata, etc), we'd need a new column with new specific meaning."}, {'account_id': 7179, 'date': '2013-10-25 19:18:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks all for your comments on this topic.  From the IRC chat yesterday and the comments here, it sounds like the consensus is that if we want a field to come back from the API that shows the last time any user-modified field was updated, it should get a new column in the DB and be returned in a new field (rather than in the existing "updated" field).

I'll discuss this with the user who reported the original issue.  If it's high enough priority, I'll open a blueprint for the change and bring it up in IRC again.

For reference, here's the relevant part of the IRC chat from yesterday:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/49749/'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-10-25 19:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My understanding was that the new field (in the database) would get stuffed into the old field in the API, making the updated_at field behave like some thing it should have been all along.'}, {'account_id': 7179, 'date': '2013-10-25 20:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

That sounds fine to me as well.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-02 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-02 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-24 16:25:51.000000000', 'message': 'Include instance sub-object updated dates when returning instance info

When getting instance info from the database, the "updated_at" field
currently shows the last updated date for certain fields, such as
server name.  However, the "updated_at" field doesn't reflect the
last time instance sub-objects such as info_cache, security_groups,
metadata, or system_metadata were updated.

This change updates the get_by_uuid and get_by_id logic so that the
"updated_at" field for the instance returns the latest updated date
for the instance and instance sub-objects.

Fixes bug 1237106

Change-Id: Ice82756e8fad7d4808f7d0e58264d08d4e285ea0
'}]
commit_message:
Include instance sub-object updated dates when returning instance info

When getting instance info from the database, the "updated_at" field
currently shows the last updated date for certain fields, such as
server name.  However, the "updated_at" field doesn't reflect the
last time instance sub-objects such as info_cache, security_groups,
metadata, or system_metadata were updated.

This change updates the get_by_uuid and get_by_id logic so that the
"updated_at" field for the instance returns the latest updated date
for the instance and instance sub-objects.

Fixes bug 1237106

Change-Id: Ice82756e8fad7d4808f7d0e58264d08d4e285ea0

commit_message:
Closes-Bug #1238293: Admin for tenant can view ports belonging to other tenants upon executing quantum port-list

Description:

	Disallow admin of a tenant from viewing ports and networks
	that belong to other tenants.

Change-Id: I56f5add2e44c5aeed93a7a0c2d17fea893b2ecbd

Don't like the name, but this seems to have the spirit of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44787/ which is winning me over more by how it simplifies the constraints on the DiskFile interface as it's used by the WSGI layer and opened some unique opportunities to do under the hood checks and optimizations.

Are there any public methods that are only used on the OnDiskContainerBroker which you could move out of ContainerBroker interface?

Is there anything you can do in OnDiskContainerBroker that would be awesome for background processes but wouldn't be possible in ContainerBroker/WSGI (future work)?"}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-09-20 00:12:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(9 inline comments)

Good start, would like to see parallels to the DiskFile work since that is how at least Gluster-Swift would like to integrate as a backend."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-09-24 18:39:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

Looks like I addressed everything. Will turn around soon.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-09-24 21:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-24 22:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-09 22:25:14.000000000', 'message': 'No more db anything outside of db.py

Okay, it was a bit of a lie since we still have a few references to
broker.db_file scattered around, mostly as os.path.exists(db_file).
Those are to be rolled up in the "back-end initialization improvement"
review, so pretend they are gone.

This patch addresses a more difficult part: how to change what
a backend takes, from a file name to something more abstract,
while not blowing up the replicator.

At this point, the '.db' suffixes are no more visible to users
of backends, although hashes are still calculated above the API.
Even so, this was a little tricky.

Change-Id: I79a8c7bb82a20554080be06b211a8e06edc51c6d
'}, {'created': '2013-09-19 04:39:47.000000000', 'message': 'Drop knowledge of db from node servers

commit_message:
Drop knowledge of db from node servers

Since the draft of this patch was posted, a promising approach
was suggested by ondisk.py. It allows us to not to attempt to
shoehorn the use of replicators and auditors into the broker API
which knows of no databases. Accordingly, this version is more
aggressive and not only gets rid of ".db" suffix, but the
whole hash and path calculations in servers.

Change-Id: I79a8c7bb82a20554080be06b211a8e06edc51c6d

commit_message:
Specifics for nova install in Debian.

This patch removes things which are not needed to be in
the Debian installation chapter for Nova, and adds some
Debian specifics (plus remove the "Notes for Debian
users).

Note that this is a break-down of:
https://review.openstack.org/54394/

into smaller patches.

backport: havana

Change-Id: I3c0f538acb392194733293478fa35e9824328fff

commit_message:
Spefics for Debian in heat

The patch removes unecessary steps durring the installation
process for the Debian manual (these are automated in the
Debian packages).

Change-Id: I1eb8335c75b62aa58976ce78e66d04c5c34f8461
backport:havana

commit_message:
Specifics for Debian in Ceilometer

This patch adds Debian specifics for the use of Debconf,
and removes the unwanted parts of the manual that are
automatically configured in the Debian package.

backport: havana
Change-Id: I40e2a17cdc6fa7f5ff4468a2e75e2302c902c7b2

commit_message:
Debian specifics for Glance

This patch adds Debian specifics for Glance, and removes
the parts which aren't needed for Debian (since the
configuration is automated in Debian).

Note that this is a break-down of:
https://review.openstack.org/54394/

into smaller patches.

backport: havana

Change-Id: I72c6f1958c292d86cd328a186d717d7022be59a2

commit_message:
Debian specifics for keystone

This patch adds Debian specifics for the Keystone install
chapter.

Note that this is a break-down of:
https://review.openstack.org/54394/

into smaller patches.

backport: havana

Change-Id: I9c7383f3daffab06fbe12d35208923eda00b5207

commit_message:
Add pipeline configuration for tempurl with swauth

The pipeline needs tempurl added before the auth middleware (swauth).
In addition we need to set allow_overrides=true when using swauth and
tempurl. This change introduces an attribute which an be overridden to
make both these changes.

* Add toggleable attribute to configure tempurl + swauth
* Update README with attribute info
* Add condition to proxy-server.conf template to insert tempurl into
     pipeline
* Take account of new dynamic role attribute
        [:swift][:management_server_chef_role]
* Correct name spelling

Change-Id: I035793230372c1a02de5f906f2ff6dde9f27d3ab

commit_message:
Adds redirection attribute for cron

Adds redirection attribute for cron jobs
to allow configuration downstream.  Possible
uses are no redirection(nil), /dev/null,
pipe to mail, logger, etc.

Change-Id: I384d399ee4c147a170b368a15997bc8f6686b372

commit_message:
Remove duplicated test

Function test_create_instance_with_img_ref_associates_config_drive
do the same as function test_create_instance_associates_config_drive
(identical bodies with different names)

Change-Id: I3c77d9249150231831f2e7eba1ccd493867ca5c0

[{'created': '2013-10-29 01:21:36.000000000', 'message': "Correct exception handling

Previously, it was possible for an exception to be hidden and cause other
errors for example:
    UnboundLocalError: local variable 'port' referenced before assignment
was previously occuring if e.status_code != 404

Fixes bug: 1245700

Change-Id: I27e44ffd33a73c88745de8fda8fd7c374435808a

Fixes bug: 1245700

Change-Id: I27e44ffd33a73c88745de8fda8fd7c374435808a
"}]
commit_message:
Correct exception handling

Previously, it was possible for an exception to be hidden and cause other
errors for example:
    UnboundLocalError: local variable 'port' referenced before assignment
was previously occuring if e.status_code != 404

Fixes bug: 1245700

Change-Id: I27e44ffd33a73c88745de8fda8fd7c374435808a

commit_message:
Add missing fields in DriverBlockDevice

Pylint reports the following, let's clean them up
["Instance of 'DriverBlockDevice' has no '_fields' member", ""]
["Instance of 'DriverBlockDevice' has no '_legacy_fields' member", ""]

Change-Id: Iaf56dc35ce5ad963a6fb50d6641b203409ca6798
Closes-Bug: #1214377

commit_message:
Check the run_context.loaded_recipes rather than the run_list, removed sysctl

* The 'openstack-network::server' recipe is most likely contained in a role and
  not explicitly in the run_list.
* The sysctl cookbook is unused and was removed as a dependency.
* The test was removed because I could not figure out how to stub the
  run_context of the chef_run and we are using ChefSpec 1.2 and all the
  documentation is for ChefSpec 3.0. I've commented it out to revisit when we
  upgrade to 3.0.

Change-Id: I4f4c60eaec9391c2871942dc95b557468f3bf85a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 15:28:56.000000000', 'message': "Update schema_diff.py to use 'postgresql' URLs.

This gets rid of a SQLAlchemy deprecation warning when using this tool w/
PostgreSQL:

The SQLAlchemy PostgreSQL dialect has been renamed from 'postgres' to
'postgresql'. The new URL format is
postgresql[+driver]://<user>:<pass>@<host>/<dbname>

This appears to have been deprecated in the SQLAlchemy 0.6 series so I think we
are Okay to remove it now.

Change-Id: If8fdf822ba452b387e9f2f3ec7c9157e4ae932f9
"}]
commit_message:
Update schema_diff.py to use 'postgresql' URLs.

This gets rid of a SQLAlchemy deprecation warning when using this tool w/
PostgreSQL:

The SQLAlchemy PostgreSQL dialect has been renamed from 'postgres' to
'postgresql'. The new URL format is
postgresql[+driver]://<user>:<pass>@<host>/<dbname>

This appears to have been deprecated in the SQLAlchemy 0.6 series so I think we
are Okay to remove it now.

Change-Id: If8fdf822ba452b387e9f2f3ec7c9157e4ae932f9

commit_message:
Remove docker exercise

No other hypervisor has a dedicated exercise, docker should be
tested just by testing the nova APIs, not on it's own.

Change-Id: Ifc788815380e8502449171410dea8260786a1e79

commit_message:
Fix query error on dhcp release port for postgresql

This is achieved by disabling eager loading and
hence by avoiding incurring in left outer joins
that cannot be applied because of a nullable
side.

Closes-bug: #1246788

Change-Id: I16bcc738a43609f715c2561413c6387f443bd99c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-31 14:29:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE and make it the default

Adds a new FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE option to lib/nova which
is by default enabled. Using config drive should speed
things up a bit and is a more likely production default
instead of file injection.

Change-Id: I2388ef0df12a6289b619bfaf30cb952fcc48ef41
'}]
commit_message:
Add FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE and make it the default

Adds a new FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE option to lib/nova which
is by default enabled. Using config drive should speed
things up a bit and is a more likely production default
instead of file injection.

Change-Id: I2388ef0df12a6289b619bfaf30cb952fcc48ef41

[{'created': '2013-10-31 20:49:35.000000000', 'message': 'Turn off Nova firewall driver when using Neutron

As referenced in the OpenStack documentation, the firewall_driver in
nova.conf should be set to nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver, "so
that nova-compute does not perform iptables-based filtering itself".

Without this change, the driver gets set to
nova.virt.libvirt.firewall.IptablesFirewallDriver, which seems to
make networking unusable.

Change-Id: Id9cce0f5f4efe719683aaf3284b128188b61b919
Closes-bug: #1246888
'}]
commit_message:
Turn off Nova firewall driver when using Neutron

As referenced in the OpenStack documentation, the firewall_driver in
nova.conf should be set to nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver, "so
that nova-compute does not perform iptables-based filtering itself".

Without this change, the driver gets set to
nova.virt.libvirt.firewall.IptablesFirewallDriver, which seems to
make networking unusable.

Change-Id: Id9cce0f5f4efe719683aaf3284b128188b61b919
Closes-bug: #1246888

commit_message:
Add tempest unit test to verify the test list

If there is an error in a test file it could potentially not get run
in the tox jobs used for gating. This commit adds a test which looks
for ImportFailures in the test list to ensure that all the test files
will get run in the gate.

Change-Id: Ia0a5831810d04f2201bd856039362b4a30f39319

'}, {'account_id': 7139, 'date': '2013-10-11 06:06:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Salvatore, sorry for my back step review! 

After looking into https://review.openstack.org/#/c/50542/, I suggest to create a separate base class with admin credential, and put tests that need to be run as admin into a separate directory(e.g. 'volume/admin').

The main reason is that it hold the same structure with other components api tests. how do you think?"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-10-11 08:10:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I would just say that I have no strong opinion - it's pretty much a non-argument to me.

It's likely there within the project there are both classes with both clients in it and other cases where admin classes are split out. Since I've not authority or experience in this project, I'll leave that decision to somebody from the core team.

Ultimately I went for a single class as I though tests should be classified according to the feature they validate, not to the level of authorization the API being tested requires."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-10-14 12:39:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-10-14 12:53:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I have added the Admin class but acted slightly different from the patch referenced by the reviewer.

this is because some of the tests I've implemented require both admin and ordinary client to be performed correctly.
For instance, tests validating enable_snat should work in the following way:
- request to change enable_snat setting performed with admin creds
- request to view enable_snat setting performed with tenant creds

Of course one could just use admin creds, but the test will be less representative of real usage in that case."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-14 13:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-09-20 11:22:34.000000000', 'message': 'API tests for neutron router gateway

This patch adds tests for validating the Neutron API for managing
router gateways.

To run these tests successfully, the neutron client has been changed
to send the enable_snat attribute to the server only when executing
with admin credentials; this implied also a bit of refactoring in
test_quotas, which uses an admin client too.

Also, this patch adds the capability of specifying filter when
querying the API for ports, as this is needed by gateway tests.

Change-Id: I4e92384559bb2093c0eddf78f5dbb526af1acc38
Closes-Bug: #1228091

commit_message:
API tests for neutron router gateway

This patch adds tests for validating the Neutron API for managing
router gateways.

To run these tests successfully, the neutron client has been augmented
with a method to send the enable_snat attribute to the server; this
method should be invoked only when the client has admin credentials;

Also, this patch adds the capability of specifying filter when
querying the API for ports, as this is needed by gateway tests.

Change-Id: I4e92384559bb2093c0eddf78f5dbb526af1acc38
Closes-Bug: #1228091

[{'created': '2013-11-01 06:14:55.000000000', 'message': 'Only run yum install once per package block

before we would get this:
yum install a
yum install a b
yum install a b c

Now we just get
yum install a b c

Change-Id: I2067922ab03de9488a0cd4e08c8d44c00296cd6a
Closes-bug: #1235796
'}]
commit_message:
Only run yum install once per package block

before we would get this:
yum install a
yum install a b
yum install a b c

Now we just get
yum install a b c

Change-Id: I2067922ab03de9488a0cd4e08c8d44c00296cd6a
Closes-bug: #1235796

'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2013-10-30 09:28:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Overall, the changes look good, but I think you missed 2 spots in parser.py. Consequently, I think you should invert your logic:
 * Make stack_get filter by tenant by default
 * Add a stack_admin_get for the one place where we need it.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 9189, 'date': '2013-10-30 15:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9189, 'date': '2013-10-30 15:46:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I updated the patch to include the two missing spots in parser.py and double checked that nothing else was missing.

I would, however, recommend against renaming it to stack_admin_get because the purpose of this change is to remove admin checks from the database layer, and renaming it would be similar to moving the admin flag check from inside the method to its name.

Renaming it would imply that the database is still aware of "authorization rules".'}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-10-30 16:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Agreed that in-general the changes look fine, but I'd like to know what the plan is for "the admin check can be done elsewhere" and perhaps see that as a first patch upon which this one depends. Otherwise I worry that we leave ourselves open to leaking information.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-30 16:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2013-10-30 16:28:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Well, OK, can you suggest an alternative naming then? My point is to have stack_get be the safe default use everywhere, and a special one which doesn't take the tenant into account. It will also drastically reduce your patch size."}, {'account_id': 9189, 'date': '2013-10-30 19:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9189, 'date': '2013-10-30 20:07:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

After discussing it even further, we're discarding everything and just renaming the `admin=False` flag to `tenant_safe=True`, for clarity, since it feels that was the original purpose of the flag.

This way the `stack_get` is still safe to be used anywhere and the intent of the function will be clearer.

Right now this difference may seem trivial, but when working on the management API (http://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/management-api), the use of the admin flag made it look obscure. We can gladly submit a draft version to better illustrate this, if needed."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-30 20:32:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-29 18:45:00.000000000', 'message': 'Remove admin checks from database layer

Rather than having SQL Alchemy API check for admin roles/flags, it
should just return the data that was being requested.

To achieve this, two things needed to be done:

1. stack_get: this function does not check for tenant_id or admin flags
anymore, it just takes show_deleted into account when returning a stack;

2. stack_get_by_tenant: this function now enforces that the stack
tenant_id matches the context tenant_id. This method replaced previous
uses of stack_get

This way the admin check can be done elsewhere and the appropriate
function (stack_get or stack_get_by_tenant) can be used to retrieve
data.

Change-Id: I32c1156c8782bad39a265c77aad088c96400f69f
Closes-Bug: 1245952
'}, {'created': '2013-10-30 15:36:27.000000000', 'message': 'Remove admin checks from database layer

Rather than having SQL Alchemy API check for admin roles/flags, it
should just return the data that was being requested.

To achieve this, two things needed to be done:

1. stack_get: this function does not check for tenant_id or admin flags
anymore, it just takes show_deleted into account when returning a stack;

2. stack_get_by_tenant: this function now enforces that the stack
tenant_id matches the context tenant_id. This method replaced previous
uses of stack_get

This way the admin check can be done elsewhere and the appropriate
function (stack_get or stack_get_by_tenant) can be used to retrieve
data.

Change-Id: I32c1156c8782bad39a265c77aad088c96400f69f
Closes-Bug: 1245952
'}, {'created': '2013-10-30 19:52:03.000000000', 'message': 'Rename admin flag on SqlAlchemy#stack_get

The `admin` flag was only used to avoid doing a tenant_id check between
the stack and the context.tenant_id, so it was renamed to `tenant_safe`

Closes-Bug: 1245952
'}, {'created': '2013-10-30 23:31:05.000000000', 'message': 'Rename admin flag on SqlAlchemy#stack_get

commit_message:
Rename admin flag on SqlAlchemy#stack_get

The `admin` flag was only used to avoid doing a tenant_id check between
the stack and the context.tenant_id, so it was renamed to `tenant_safe`
for better clarity.

Change-Id: I32c1156c8782bad39a265c77aad088c96400f69f
Closes-Bug: 1245952

[{'created': '2013-11-01 08:20:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes neutron setup for Debian

This patch completely removes the section_neutron-install.xml
section from the Debian install-guide, since that part is
completely automated in Debian, and describes how the plugin
system works in Debian. It then customize the other sections
to fit the Debian installation procedure.

Change-Id: Ib1fabd7f64d513132484b98541cef2e4276ccfe8
backport: havana

commit_message:
Fixes neutron setup for Debian

This patch completely removes the section_neutron-install.xml
section from the Debian install-guide, since that part is
completely automated in Debian, and describes how the plugin
system works in Debian. It then customize the other sections
to fit the Debian installation procedure.

Change-Id: Ib1fabd7f64d513132484b98541cef2e4276ccfe8
backport: havana

commit_message:
Adds a new debconf chapter

This patch adds a new debconf chapter in the Debian docs.
It describe generalities about the Debconf OpenStack. It
explains how the following is handled:
- Database config (using dbconfig-common)
- RabbitMQ config
- API endpoint registrations
- keystone_authtoken config
- preseeding

Also, a number of screenshots are added.

Note that this is a break-down of:
https://review.openstack.org/54394/

into smaller patches.

backport: havana
Change-Id: Ia5d8e5fc3d397f9441ecb50ef4a3458672307bdc

commit_message:
Recommend vCenter VMDK driver and other edits

Updated the VMware VMDK driver doc to recommend the vCenter VMDK
driver since the ESX VMDK driver has not been tested extensively.
Also made other edits to make the document easier to read.

backport: havana

Fixes bug #1246913

Change-Id: Iae910c59d0950cb19d18cded6a99842a1cbfd8b6
(cherry picked from commit 87d8f50d89ec2256cac5d0a270d8457bb98547e4)

commit_message:
Add notification for host operation

Add notification for the following host operations:
1) compute/api.py:set_host_enabled
2) compute/api.py:host_power_action
3) compute/api.py:set_host_maintenance

This can make sure 3rd party callers can get host status quickly.

Implements bp host-operation-notification

Change-Id: Ib4cc80e568b6028afbdd6cb86f6ac8edeed4f933

commit_message:
Fix checksum verification exception.

Previously if an invalid checksum was found, the exception would not be
raised. This commit also makes the tests for backup run in fake mode
run again (turns out there was no reason to disable them) since they
helped find this, and cleans up an issue with the restore backup test
(it used the current size of an instance created elsewhere for no
reason).

Fixes bug 1246368

Change-Id: I96a570a93695b017e5c6966fa1482d6ec5aef426
